p: The concept ‘coping’ derives from observation of the manner in which people act using available existing resources and within a limited range of expectations to achieve various ends under stressful conditions (Davies 2000). Davies ( 2000:37) states that coping in general involves no more than managing resources; but, in this case, it is carried out in unusual, abnormal and adverse situations. Blaikie et al. ( 1994) argue that household strategies are often complex and involve a number of mechanisms for maintaining resources and livelihood in times of adversity.
